properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 10:53PM MST until January 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SNOW FOR THE WEST CENTRAL IDAHO
MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT THROUGH 5 PM MST TUESDAY...

.A winter storm will move in rapidly tonight and bring mountain
snow and valley rain through Tuesday. Snowfall totals are
expected to be sufficient to warrant an advisory for the West
Central Idaho Mountains, with 4-6 inches expected in McCall and
6-9 inches at higher elevations.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6
inches, except up to 9 inches over the higher mountains.

* WHERE...West Central Idaho Mountains zone.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Tuesday. The heaviest snowfall will be
from 5 am to 11 am Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY
